text.12_Chapter, 3_Verse: to the place of the altar which he had there made at the first: and Abram prayed there in the Name of the Lord.
text.10_Chapter, 12_Verse: And Arphaxad lived after he had begotten Shelach four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.
text.10_Chapter, 4_Verse: And the Lord was revealed to punish the work of the city and the tower which the sons of men had builded.
text.10_Chapter, 1_Verse: And it was in their migrations at the beginning, that they found a plain in the land of Babel, and dwelt there.
text.7_Chapter, 17_Verse: And Noach went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and the wives of his sons with him;
text.9_Chapter, 21_Verse: the sons of Shem, Elim, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram.
text.6_Chapter, 3_Verse: Because yet a time of seven days and I will cause rain to descend upon the earth forty days and forty nights, and I will blot out every subsistence which I have made upon all the face of the earth.
text.5_Chapter, 7_Verse: But Noach found mercy before the Lord.
text.5_Chapter, 2_Verse: And the Lord said, This evil generation shall not stand before me for ever, because they are flesh, and their works are evil. A term (or length) will I give them, an hundred and twenty years, if they may be converted.
text.0_Chapter, 2_Verse: And God said, "Let light be", and light was.
text.9_Chapter, 29_Verse: And their dwelling was from Mesha, coming to Sephar, an eastern mountain.
text.10_Chapter, 8_Verse: Therefore the name of it is called Confusion, because the Lord there confused the tongue of all the earth, and from thence the Lord dispersed them upon the face of all the earth.
text.21_Chapter, 1_Verse: And he said, ‘Take please you son, your only one, whom you love, Yitzchak, and go to the land of service and bring him up there for a whole offering on one of the mountains, of which I will tell you.
text.13_Chapter, 12_Verse: And (one) came from those escaped, and showed to Abram the Ivraah; and he had remained in the plain of Moreh Amoraah, the brother of Eshkol and brother of Aner; and they were Abram's men of covenant.
text.7_Chapter, 5_Verse: And it was at the end of forty days, and Noach opened the windows of the ark which he had made.
text.11_Chapter, 12_Verse: Say now, thou art my sis­ter, that it may be well with me through thee, and my life may be preserved through thy words.
text.10_Chapter, 6_Verse: Come, We will be manifest, and will confuse their language there, that a man shall not bear the language of his companion.
text.6_Chapter, 12_Verse: In that very day entered Noach, and Shem, Cham, and Yapheth, sons of Noach, and the wife of Noach, and the three wives of his sons with them, into the ark;
text.11_Chapter, 0_Verse: And the Lord said to Abram, Go thou away from thy country, and from the house of thy father, to the land which I will show thee.
text.11_Chapter, 4_Verse: And Abram took Sara his wife, and Lot his brother's son, and all the possessions which they possessed, and the souls whom they had made subject to the law in Charan, and went forth to go into the land of Kenaan; and they came unto the land of Kenaan.
text.8_Chapter, 4_Verse: And also your blood of your lives will I require, from every beast will I require it, and from the hand of man. From the hand of the man who sheddeth the blood of his brother will I require the life of man.
text.7_Chapter, 21_Verse: Yet all the days of the earth, seed‑time and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night, shall not cease.
text.6_Chapter, 2_Verse: Also of the fowls of heaven, seven and seven, male and female, to continue the seed upon the face of all the earth.
text.6_Chapter, 23_Verse: And the waters prevailed upon the earth an hundred and fifty days.
text.10_Chapter, 18_Verse: And Peleg lived after he had begotten Reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.
text.10_Chapter, 27_Verse: And Haran died before Terach his father in the land of his nativity, in Ura of the Kasdaee.
text.32_Chapter, 0_Verse: And Yaakov lifted his eyes and saw and behold Esav was coming and with him was 400 men and he [Yaakov] divided up the children with Leah and with Rachel and with the 2 maidservants.
text.8_Chapter, 27_Verse: And Noach lived after the deluge three hundred and fifty years.
text.1_Chapter, 6_Verse: And the Lord God created man, dirt from the ground, and He blew into his nostrils a living soul, and it was for a speaking spirit in man.
text.10_Chapter, 14_Verse: And Shelach lived after he had begotten Eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
text.11_Chapter, 7_Verse: And he ascended from thence to the mountain east of Beth El, and spread out his tabernacle, having Beth El on the west and Ai on the east; and he builded there an altar before the Lord, and prayed in the name of the Lord.
text.10_Chapter, 5_Verse: And the Lord said, Behold, the people is one and the language one with all of them: and this is what they begin to do. And now nothing will be restrained from them of what they imagine to do.
text.12_Chapter, 0_Verse: And Abram went up from Mizraim, he and his wife, and all that he had, and Lot with him, unto the south.
text.7_Chapter, 20_Verse: And the Lord received with approval his oblation; and the Lord said in His Word, I will not add to curse again the earth on account of the guilt of man, because the creations of the heart of man are evil from his infancy; and I will not add again to smite every living thing as I have done.
text.8_Chapter, 5_Verse: Whoso sheddeth the blood of man, by witnesses, upon the sentence of the judges, his blood shall be shed; because in the image of the Lord made He man.
text.11_Chapter, 15_Verse: And Abram was well treated on account of her. And he had sheep, and oxen, and asses, and servants, and maidens, and camels.
text.10_Chapter, 24_Verse: And Nachor lived after he had begotten Terach a hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.
text.6_Chapter, 18_Verse: And the waters prevailed most mightily over the earth, and all the high hills were covered which were under all the heavens.
text.12_Chapter, 12_Verse: And the men of Sedom were wicked in their riches, and guilty in their bodies before the Lord greatly.
text.11_Chapter, 14_Verse: and the princes of Pharaoh saw her, and extolled her to Pharaoh; and the woman was taken to the house of Pharaoh.
text.13_Chapter, 22_Verse: if from a thread unto the sole of a sandal I take of all that is thine, (and not that thou shouldst say, I have enriched Abram,)
text.9_Chapter, 30_Verse: These are the sons of Shem, according to their progenies, according to their languages, in their lands, in their peoples.
text.10_Chapter, 20_Verse: And Reu lived after he had begotten Serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.
text.7_Chapter, 7_Verse: And he sent forth a dove from (being) with him, to see whether the waters were lightened (or consumed) from the surface of the earth.
text.9_Chapter, 18_Verse: And the frontier of Kenaanaah was from Zidon, coming to Gerar and to Azza, coming unto Sedom, and Amorah, and Admah, and Zeboim, unto Lasha.
text.8_Chapter, 12_Verse: I have set My bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a sign of the covenant between My Word and between the earth.
text.9_Chapter, 2_Verse: And the sons of Gomer, Ashkenaz, and Rephath, and Thogarmah.
text.10_Chapter, 22_Verse: And Serug lived after he had begotten Nachor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
text.6_Chapter, 14_Verse: and they entered with Noach into the ark, two and two of all flesh in which is the breath of life;
text.10_Chapter, 26_Verse: And these are the generations of Terach. Terach begat Abram, Nachor, and Haran; and Haran begat Lot.
text.8_Chapter, 28_Verse: And all the days of Noach were nine hundred and fifty years; and he died.
text.0_Chapter, 0_Verse: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.
text.5_Chapter, 16_Verse: And I, behold, I do bring the deluge of waters upon the earth to destroy all flesh in which is the breath of life from under the heavens. Every thing that is on the earth shall die.
